page.title: 10THE KING'S HEAD
page.content:
The King's Head is in Chigwell, Essex. It is a restaurant, pub and a hotel. It has two kitchens and another one which is used for weddings, parties and discos. Winston Churchill and Charles Dickens stayed in the Kings Head, and so did Queen Elizabeth 1st.
The restaurant is an 85 seater, and the function room holds 120 people. The pub was a school and then turned into a youth hostel. The pub had several names before the Kings Head. It has 37 staff and about 75% enjoy their job. The manager is very strict on under age people and drunks. The staff consists of two cleaning ladies, cooks, bar attendants, waiters and waitresses.
